title: US Consumer bounces back sharply in May By Investing.com
summary: Consumer confidence in the U.S. rebounded strongly in May, with significant improvements in expectations for business conditions, jobs, and income. The increase was broad-based across all demographics and political affiliations, driven largely by consumer expectations despite ongoing concerns about inflation and affordability.

title: Eli Lilly expands pain pipeline with acquisition of SiteOne Therapeutics By Investing.com
summary: Eli Lilly and Company is acquiring SiteOne Therapeutics for up to $1 billion to expand its non-opioid pain treatment pipeline. The acquisition includes STC-004, a promising Phase 2-ready Nav1.8 inhibitor, and aligns with Lilly's ambition to lead in next-generation pain therapeutics.

title: Lynx: Risk priced in, Nvidia could surprise to the upside By Investing.com
summary: Lynx Equity has raised its price target for Nvidia from $140 to $160, citing that risks are priced in and the company could surprise with upside earnings. The firm highlights Nvidia's resilience, new growth opportunities, and strategic moves to mitigate tariff risks.

title: Trump Media & Technology Group Announces $2.5B BTC Treasury Deal By Investing.com
summary: Trump Media & Technology Group has secured a $2.5 billion deal with institutional investors to create a Bitcoin treasury. The funds will be used to expand the company's reach and defend against financial discrimination, with the Bitcoin investment intended to support various transactions across its platforms.

title: SoundHound shares jump as Piper Sandler starts coverage at Overweight By Investing.com
summary: Piper Sandler initiated coverage on SoundHound AI with an Overweight rating and a $12 price target, highlighting the company's competitive advantage in voice-AI technology and significant market opportunities. The broker sees strong potential in quick-service restaurants and customer experience sectors, with a growing subscription-based revenue model expected to improve financial leverage.

title: 25% tariff not enough to push Apple to reshore iPhone production
summary: Morgan Stanley analysts predict that a 25% tariff on iPhones will not incentivize Apple to move production to the U.S. due to economic and logistical challenges. The bank warns that Apple's defiance could lead to further tariff escalation and potential deterioration in the company's relationship with the U.S. administration.

title: Next 300 points likely up for the S&P 500, says JPMorgan By Investing.com
summary: JPMorgan analysts predict that the S&P 500 is likely to rise by 300 points, attributing this bullish outlook to stable macroeconomic data, positive earnings, and a de-escalation of the trade war. The recent market pullback is viewed as a temporary correction rather than a long-term negative trend.

title: JPMorgan shifts to bullish stance on crypto amid sector tailwinds By Investing.com
summary: JPMorgan has adopted a bullish stance on digital assets, citing institutional adoption, positive policy developments, and regulatory progress as key drivers. The bank forecasts a 10% return for digital assets, the highest among alternative investments, and has upgraded them to an Overweight position.

title: New surveys show declining interest in EVs and the Tesla brand around the world By Investing.com
summary: New surveys indicate a global decline in consumer interest in Tesla as a preferred electric vehicle (EV) brand, with significant drops in the U.S., China, and Europe. The decrease is attributed to brand saturation, limited vehicle options, affordability issues, and increasing competition from domestic brands. Additionally, Tesla's appeal in the U.S. is becoming more politically polarized, which may impact future sales.

title: Temu owner PDD Holdings shares fall sharply on big Q1 results miss By Investing.com
summary: PDD Holdings Inc, owner of Temu, reported a significant miss in Q1 earnings and revenue, leading to an 18% drop in share prices. Despite investments in the platform ecosystem, the company's transaction services revenue fell short of projections.

title: Citi sees up to 8% downside for Stoxx 600 on Trump tariff risk By Investing.com
summary: Citi analysts project a potential 7-8% drop in the Stoxx 600 index if President Trump's 50% tariff on European goods is implemented. The uncertainty surrounding trade policy has already impacted earnings estimates and market sentiment, with further declines expected if the tariffs materialize.

title: What could be the impact of a 50% tariff on EU economy? By Investing.com
summary: U.S. President Donald Trump's potential 50% tariff on EU imports could severely impact eurozone growth and escalate trade tensions, according to UBS. The tariffs, if implemented, could lead to a deeper recession and trigger retaliatory measures from the EU, further complicating economic stability.

title: Higher U.S. futures, new Nvidia chip, falling Tesla sales
summary: U.S. stock futures rose due to the postponement of EU tariffs, Nvidia plans to launch a new AI chip in China, Tesla's European sales dropped significantly, and Bitcoin slipped from record highs.

title: By Investing.com
summary: Bitcoin is trading near record highs ahead of the Bitcoin 2025 Conference. Trump Media & Technology Group plans to raise $2.5 billion for a Bitcoin treasury, but its shares fell. Altcoins showed mixed performance.

title: Gold prices sink as Trump EU tariff delay spurs some risk, yields retreat By Investing.com
summary: Gold prices fell due to a delay in U.S. tariffs on Europe, which boosted risk appetite and stabilized bond yields. Despite this, concerns over long-term tariff impacts and Fed rate decisions persist.

title: BYD shares slide further from record highs amid price cuts, competition concerns By Investing.com
summary: BYD's Hong Kong listed shares fell 3.6% due to concerns over price cuts, increasing competition, and potential margin pressure. This decline also affected other Chinese EV stocks, with rivals experiencing similar drops.

title: Tesla Europe sales nearly halve in April as competition, Musk boycott persist By Investing.com
summary: Tesla's European sales plummeted by nearly 50% in April due to aging models, increased competition, and a boycott linked to CEO Elon Musk. The company's market share also halved, despite the overall growth in EV sales in Europe.

title: Asia stocks muted amid trade caution; Japan recovers on yen weakness By Investing.com
summary: Asian markets showed mixed performance with Japan recovering due to yen weakness, while other regions remained cautious amid U.S. trade tariff concerns. Focus is also on upcoming earnings from NVIDIA and economic readings from Japan.

title: U.S. stocks surge after Trump delays EU tariffs and consumer confidence jumps By Investing.com
summary: U.S. stocks surged after President Trump delayed EU tariffs and consumer confidence data exceeded expectations. The postponement of tariffs and the start of trade talks with the EU, along with a significant jump in consumer confidence, drove market gains.

title: Citi raises short-term gold price target to $3,500 amid tariff concerns By Investing.com
summary: Citi has raised its short-term gold price target to $3,500 per ounce due to tariff concerns and geopolitical risks, while maintaining a cautious long-term stance. The bank cites potential economic risks and high gold holdings among households as reasons for caution.
